intro: Rorippa coloradensis, commonly known as Colorado pondweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in wetlands and along the edges of lakes and ponds. The plant typically grows in shallow water, with its roots anchored in the sediment and its leaves floating on the surface. It produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Rorippa coloradensis plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
